flow.descriptionCdata:
b4c0b69e-e270-45ea-b19c-517260984c04.7fb22983-0380-4c37-baec-9873b41aa7cf.description=Starts a remediation on the given server using a set of attached/detached software policies. If the software policies information is not provided, then a full software policy remediation is performed. Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. coreVersion - The version of SAS to use. serverName - The names of the servers to remediate (separated by 'separator'). serverId - The IDs of the servers to remediate (separated by 'separator'). If provided, the 'serverName' is ignored. softwarePoliciesNames - The names of the software policies to remediate against (separated by 'separator'). The software policies need to be attached/detached to/from the server before the remediation takes place. softwarePoliciesIDs - The IDs of the software policies to remediate against (separated by 'separator'). The software policies need to be attached/detached to/from the server before the remediation takes place. If this input is provided, then 'softwarePoliciesNames' is ignored. wait - An integer value specifying how many milliseconds should be waited for the job to finish. If not specified the job is started, but may not have finished. rebootOption - Reboot Option for Remediating a server. It could be one of [suppress, per_action, at_end] or it can be left blank. Where\: - suppress - Suppress all reboots; - per_action - Reboot after each installation or uninstallation; - at_end - Reboot at the end of remediation; - left blank (no value provided) - Reboot as specified by individual software items. continueOnFailure - Set whether to continue or not if a failure happens during the remediation job. The default value is 'true'. sortPolicies - Specify whether the software policies should be remediated in alphabetical order, based on their names, on each server. The default value is 'false'. ticketID - The ticket ID for this job. If not specified it will be set default value\: 'Remediation started by SA user from OO server 'host_address' separator - The separator used for separating the inputs. The default value for the separator is a comma (,). expandAtRuntime - Specify whether the software policies attached to the servers should be expanded at runtime. The default value is 'false'. notificationFailureOwner - The email address of the owner of the job when the job failed. notificationSuccessOwner - The email address of the owner of the job when the job succeeded. notificationCancelOwner - The email address of the owner of the job when the job was canceled. notificationFailureRecipients - The email addresses to notify when the job failed. notificationSuccessRecipients - The email addresses to notify when the job succeeded. notificationCancelRecipients - The email addresses to notify when the job was canceled. scheduleDateYear - The year to be used for setting the date when the job is scheduled to start. This input must be provided for setting a job schedule. scheduleDateMonth - The month to be used for setting the date when the job is scheduled to start. It should have the value between 1 and 12. This input must be provided for setting a job schedule. scheduleDateDayOfMonth - The day to be used for setting the date when the job is scheduled to start. It should have the value between 1 and 31. This input must be provided for setting a job schedule. scheduleDateHour - The hour to be used for setting the date when the job is scheduled to start. It should have the value between 0 and 23. If not set, if will have the default value 0. scheduleDateMinute - The minute to be used for setting the date when the job is scheduled to start. It should have the value between 0 and 59. If not set, if will have the default value 0. scheduleDateSecond - The second to be used for setting the date when the job is scheduled to start. It should have the value between 0 and 59. If not set, if will have the default value 0. scheduleDateTimezone - The timezone used to express the job schedule date. If not set, it will have the default value GMT. Responses\: success - The operation completed successfully. failure - Something went wrong. Returns\: returnResult - The id of the created job. b4c0b69e-e270-45ea-b19c-517260984c04.a6b00c37-df9a-43a4-b8f0-f11414041caf.description=Checks to see if a job is completed or not Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. coreVersion - The version of SAS to use. jobID - the id of the job Responses\: running - job is still running completed - job has completed or is terminated in error failure - failed to retrieve data b4c0b69e-e270-45ea-b19c-517260984c04.b793fb3b-66a9-4255-b9a0-dc68e30501de.description=
This operation waits for the number of seconds specified in the "seconds" input.

Inputs\:
    seconds - The number of seconds to wait.

Results\:
    resultString – This is the primary output. It contains the "completed sleep" message if the operation completed successfully and an error message otherwise. 

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.
b4c0b69e-e270-45ea-b19c-517260984c04.c2817e19-4a74-427f-b355-a35d8aecc7e0.description=Retrieves the properties for a Job Info. Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. coreVersion - The version of SAS to use. jobID - the id of the job Responses\: success - retrieved successfully failure - failed to retrieve data Returns\: description - The description of this object. blockedReason - The reason why this job is blocked. cancelledReason - The reason why this job is canceled. endDate - The date at which this job will cease to run. notificationFailureOwner - The user who will own this job if it fails. notificationSuccessOwner - The user who will own this job if it completes. notificationFailureRecipients - A ; delimited list of users who will receive notification if this job fails. notificationSuccessRecipients - A ; delimited list of users who will receive notification if this job completes. serverName - The name of the server associated with this job. serverId - The id of the server associated with this job. staleDate - The date after which this job is considered stale. startDate - The date where this job started. status - This object's status. username - This object's user name. userTag - This object's unique user tag. b4c0b69e-e270-45ea-b19c-517260984c04.c8d545f0-4ed9-47aa-b67d-4947a2c04ee2.prompt=Enter the SAS version used\: b4c0b69e-e270-45ea-b19c-517260984c04.d64cf44c-7d66-4abe-9751-76d25fc19569.description=Attaches a software policy to a list of servers/device groups/hypervisors. Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. coreVersion - The version of SAS to use. policyName - The name of the policy to attach. policyID - The ID of the policy to attach. If this input is provided, then 'policyName' is ignored. attachableName - The names, separated by 'separator', of the attachable objects to attach the policy to. attachableID - The IDs, separated by 'separator', of the attachable objects to attach the policy to. If this input is provided, then 'attachableName' is ignored. attachableType - The type of the attachable objects (all must be of the same type). Can be\: SERVER, DEVICE_GROUP, HYPERVISOR. separator - The separator used for separating the inputs. The default value for the separator is comma (,). Responses\: success - The operation completed successfully. failure - Something went wrong. b4c0b69e-e270-45ea-b19c-517260984c04.e45cfa3a-74df-47b4-bb67-697cea16e55e.description=Counts from one number to another number. 
Inputs\:
from - The number to start counting at.
to - The number to count to.
incrementBy - The number to increment by while counting. If unspecified this is 1. If you wanted to count 2,4,6,8 this would be 2.
reset - If true, then the counter will restart counting from the beginning.

NOTE\: These values must be between -9223372036854775808 and 9223372036854775807

Returns\:
The number that was just counted.

Note\: the primary result is resultString, Result can also be used. result (All lower case) should not be used as it is the response code.

Responses\:
has more - Not yet done counting.
no more - Done counting. This will only be returned once, then counting restarts.
failure - Something went wrong.
b4c0b69e-e270-45ea-b19c-517260984c04.fe641bc4-61af-4e0a-b31d-9c6f356234d5.description=
This operation can be used to find the SA version in the form of 'sasXXX' (Similar to the entries in the Selection List 'SAS Version'). Output of this operations  could be mapped to the input parameter 'coreVersion' which is used in other SA Operations. For SA version 6.x, this operation is not supported. For other SA versions, if the output variable 'coreVersion' is reported with 'UNKNOWN', then user is recommended to manually find the SA version to use in other SA Operations.

Inputs\:
coreHost - IP Address or DNS name of the SA Web Service.
corePort - HTTP(S) port of SA Web Service. By default it is '443'.
coreProtocol - HTTP / HTTPS. By default it is 'HTTPS'.
coreUsername - Username of the SA.
corePassword - Password of SA user.

Outputs\:
status - Operation completion Status.
coreVersion - SA version.  It could be one of [sas10, sas101, sas102, sas105, UNKNOWN].

Responses\:
success - retrieved successfully
failure - failed to retrieve data
flow.name: Installar NetFramework
